definition: to be killed for a righteous cause/to die a martyr

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The soldiers knew they could not escape, so they determined to die game.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们知道他们已经无法逃走了，于是决心英勇就义。

sentences.english: These my eyes an easy death shall close.
sentences.chinese: 在我从容就义之后，我的眼睛将永远闭上。

sentences.english: Power takes as inacknowledgment the askews of its victims.
sentences.chinese: 势力以为就义者的痛苦是感恩戴德。

sentences.english: If I could return to that time, I wish I would be martyred.
sentences.chinese: 如果能回到当时，我愿去就义。

sentences.english: They went to their death unflinchingly, worthy of the title of heroes.
sentences.chinese: 慷慨赴死，从容就义，他们当之无愧。

sentences.english: He killed his chances of success.

definition: heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
to glance back/fig. to regret/to have second thoughts about sth
brave/heroic
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to meet death
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to sacrifice one's life
rather die than submit (idiom)
to die for one's country
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
faithful and unchanging (idiom); steadfast
to commit one's energy to/to devote oneself to/to sacrifice one's life for/(coll.) (of a woman) to give one's virginity to
martyr
to give one's body for the nation (idiom); to spend one's whole life in the service of the country
